sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Wild Animal Public Safety Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Wild Animal Public Safety Act.

sections.heading: Prohibition.  Notwithstanding any other provision of law to the contrary, it is unlawful for any person to allow any member of the public to come into direct contact with a covered animal
sections.text: Prohibition. Notwithstanding any other provision of law to the contrary, it is unlawful for any person to allow any member of the public to come into direct contact with a covered animal.

sections.heading: Nonapplication of Act.  This Act does not apply to direct contact between a covered animal and any of the following:
sections.text: Nonapplication of Act. This Act does not apply to direct contact between a covered animal and any of the following:

sections.heading: Penalty. Any person who violates the provisions of this Act is guilty of a Class B misdemeanor.
sections.text: Penalty. Any person who violates the provisions of this Act is guilty of a Class B misdemeanor.

sections.heading: Enforcement. Any law enforcement officer or peace officer employed by this State or by any county or municipality within this State may enforce the provisions of this Act
sections.text: The Attorney General, or a State's Attorney of the county in which a violation of this Act occurred, may bring an action in the

sections.heading: Severability. The provisions of this Act are severable under Section 1.31 of the Statute on Statutes.
sections.text: Severability. The provisions of this Act are severable under Section 1.31 of the Statute on Statutes.
